page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: SOMERSHAM IS SURROUNDED BY FARMLAND AND IS SITUATED ON THE EDGE OF THE FENS. FEN SOIL IS LARGELY PEAT WITH A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF NITROGEN WHICH IS VERY SUITABLE FOR INTENSIVE CROP CULTIVATION. IN THE FIELDS AROUND SOMERSHAM CROPS SUCH AS WHEAT, BARLEY, OIL SEED RAPE, SUGAR BEET, POTATOES AND VEGETABLES ARE GROWN. MORE SIGNIFICANT, HOWEVER, IS THE CULTIVATION OF FRUIT. THERE ARE SEVERAL LARGE ORCHARDS OF APPLE TREES AND ALSO PEARS, PLUMS AND GREENGAGES. SOFT FRUIT IS ALSO GROWN ON SMALL HOLDINGS AROUND SOMERSHAM. THE STRAWBERRY FIELDS ARE RENOWNED AND ATTRACT PEOPLE FROM THE SURROUNDING AREA TO COME AND PICK THEIR OWN FOR A LOWER PRICE THAN THE READY PICKED ONES. OTHER SOFT FRUIT INCLUDES GOOSEBERRIES, RASPBERRIES AND BLACK- CURRANTS.
